cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 80 miles E of Chetumal, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north across the Yucatan Channel, then north-northeast through the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Panhandle and northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Isle of Youth; Mexican coast from Tulum to Cabo Catoche
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast from Louisiana–Mississippi border eastward to the Florida Big Bend and Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤17%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible if the storm tracks farther west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected because offshore winds will dominate the Mississippi coast given the forecast track east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain (1–3 inches) from outer rainbands Tuesday–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor short-term disruptions to marine traffic possible due to scattered squalls and higher seas in the outer Gulf.
